intro: Aulomyrcia longipes var. spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant features lanceolate to spatulate leaves, which give it its botanical variant name "spathulata," meaning spatula-shaped. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
